etymology.interpretation: The character 覺(覺) (jué, 'feel') uses the phonetic component 𦥯 with the semantic component 見(見) (jiàn, 'see'), logically tying the sense of feeling to perception or awareness, which involves seeing or noticing something.
etymology.simplification: The simplified form 覚 used in some historical periods replaced the phonetic component to reduce complexity, though it is no longer widely used.

examples.chinese: 听到消息后(聽到消息後)，我覺得非常震惊(我覺得非常震驚)。
examples.pinyin: Tīng dào xiāoxī hòu, wǒ juéde fēicháng zhènjīng.
examples.english: After hearing the news, I felt very shocked.

examples.chinese: 独处时(獨處時)，我覺得格外轻松(我覺得格外輕鬆)。
examples.pinyin: Dú chǔ shí, wǒ juéde géwài qīngsōng.
examples.english: When I am alone, I feel exceptionally relaxed.

examples.chinese: 失去朋友后(失去朋友後)，他覺得生活变得空虚(他覺得生活變得空虛)。
examples.pinyin: Shīqù péngyǒu hòu, tā juéde shēnghuó biànde kōngxū.
examples.english: After losing his friend, he felt that life had become empty.
